Sequence Information.Peptide Name: NP-1 2d analog (Synthetic AMPs, Arg-rich, 2S=S, UCBB1a; Variants: 2e, 2f)
Sequence Information.Source: circularization, amino acid SUBSTITUTION, defensin analog, animal-derived, natural derivatives

Literature.Author: Yu Q, Lehrer RI, Tam JP.2000
Literature.Title: Engineered salt-insensitive alpha-defensins with end-to-end circularized structures

Sequence Information.Comments: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (84.85%) toRabbit neutrophil peptide 1 NP-1R: 30%; G: 21%.Activity: low salt, active against E. coli (MIC 1.8 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa (MIC 13.4 ug/ml), K. pneumoniae (MIC 3.2 ug/ml), L. monocytogenes (MIC 2.8 ug/ml), and C.albicans (MIC >158 ug/ml).Antimicrobial robustness: NaCl-sensitive:E. coli (100 mM), NaCl-sensitive:S. typhimurium (100 mM), NaCl-insensitive:P. aeruginosa (100 mM), NaCl-sensitive:K. pneumoniae (100 mM), NaCl-insensitive:L. monocytogenes (100 mM).analog 2e: C10 is sulfonic acid.analog 2f is a dimer of 2d, remains active and more active.
